    A

    api - Variable in class ElevatorAPI
    An instance of GenericAPI which provides the direct interface to the Modbus TCP/IP server.

    B

    blockDuringEmergency(Request, RequestHandler) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Blocks all commands during an emergency state, except for an emergency reset command.

    C

    clear() - Method in class RequestHandler
    Clears all pending Request objects from the queue.
    client - Variable in class GenericAPI
    The `ModbusClient` instance responsible for establishing and managing the network connection, and for handling the Modbus TCP/IP protocol communication with the target Modbus server.
    closeDoor() - Method in class ElevatorAPI
    Initiates the process to close the elevator door and waits until the door is confirmed closed.
    closeIfOpen() - Method in class DoorManager
    Attempts to close the elevator door if it is currently open.
    currentFloor - Variable in class ElevatorController
    Tracks the elevator's current floor number.

    D

    dir - Variable in class Request
    The intended direction of the elevator associated with the request ('u' for up, 'd' for down, '-' for internal/admin).
    direction - Variable in class ElevatorController
    Represents the current operational direction of the elevator.
    Direction - Enum Class in Unnamed Package
    The Direction enum represents the possible operational states regarding the movement and direction of the elevator.
    doorManager - Variable in class ElevatorController
    An instance of DoorManager responsible for encapsulating the logic and operations related to the elevator's doors, including opening, closing, and managing their state.
    DoorManager - Class in Unnamed Package
    The DoorManager class is responsible for controlling the opening and closing of the elevator doors.
    DoorManager(ElevatorAPI) - Constructor for class DoorManager
    Constructs a new DoorManager instance, associating it with a specific ElevatorAPI instance.
    DOWN - Enum constant in enum class Direction
    Represents the state where the elevator is currently moving or intends to move downwards.

    E

    elevator - Variable in class DoorManager
    A final reference to the ElevatorAPI instance.
    elevator - Variable in class ElevatorController
    An instance of ElevatorAPI that provides the low-level interface to interact with the simulated elevator hardware.
    ElevatorAPI - Class in Unnamed Package
    The ElevatorAPI class serves as the primary high-level interface for controlling and monitoring the elevator's physical components.
    ElevatorAPI() - Constructor for class ElevatorAPI
    Constructs a new ElevatorAPI instance.
    ElevatorController - Class in Unnamed Package
    The `ElevatorController` class is the central command unit for managing the elevator's operations.
    ElevatorController(ElevatorAPI) - Constructor for class ElevatorController
    Constructs a new ElevatorController instance.

    F

    floor - Variable in class Request
    The target floor associated with this request.

    G

    GenericAPI - Class in Unnamed Package
    The GenericAPI class provides a high-level abstraction for interacting with a Modbus TCP/IP server.
    GenericAPI() - Constructor for class GenericAPI
    Constructs a new GenericAPI instance and attempts to establish an initial connection to the Modbus TCP/IP server.
    getBooleanInput(int) - Method in class GenericAPI
    Reads the current binary state (ON or OFF) of a single Modbus discrete input coil.
    getCurrentFloor() - Method in class ElevatorAPI
    Determines the current floor of the elevator by checking the status of dedicated floor sensors.
    getCurrentFloor() - Method in class ElevatorController
    Retrieves the elevator's current floor.
    getDirection() - Method in class ElevatorController
    Retrieves the current operational direction of the elevator.
    getNextRequest(int, Direction) - Method in class RequestHandler
    Implements the core elevator scheduling logic by identifying and returning the highest-priority Request from the queue based on the elevator's current position and direction of travel.
    getQueue() - Method in class RequestHandler
    Returns a reference to the internal List that holds all currently pending Request objects.

    H

    handleEmergency() - Method in class ElevatorController
    Initiates an emergency state for the elevator.
    handleEmergencyStop(Request, RequestHandler) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Handles an emergency stop request.
    handleIdleState(Request) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Manages the elevator's idle state.
    handleSameFloorRequest(Request, RequestHandler) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Handles the scenario where the elevator is already at the requested floor.
    handleSystemReset(Request, RequestHandler) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Handles a system reset request.

    I

    id - Variable in class Request
    The unique identifier for this request.
    idCounter - Variable in class RequestHandler
    An integer counter used to generate unique identifiers (Request.id) for each new request added to the system.
    IDLE - Enum constant in enum class Direction
    Represents the state where the elevator is currently stationary, not moving in any particular direction.

    A boolean flag indicating whether the elevator is currently in an emergency state.

    K

    kind - Variable in class Request
    The kind of request, indicating its purpose.

    M

    main(String[]) - Static method in class Main
    The `main` method is the designated starting point for the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) when the Elevator Simulation application is executed.
    Main - Class in Unnamed Package
    The `Main` class serves as the singular entry point for the Elevator Simulation application.
    Main() - Constructor for class Main
     
    modbusLock - Variable in class GenericAPI
    A final `Object` instance used as a monitor (lock) to ensure thread-safe access to the `ModbusClient`.
    motorOn(int, boolean) - Method in class ElevatorAPI
    Controls the main elevator motors based on a specified speed category and a boolean value.
    moveDown(int, int, int, int, int) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Controls the downward movement of the elevator in phases: fast, crawl, and slow crawl.
    moveToTargetFloor(Request, RequestHandler) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Manages the primary movement logic for the elevator to reach a requested target floor.
    moveUp(int, int, int, int, int) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Controls the upward movement of the elevator in phases: fast, crawl, and slow crawl.

    O

    openDoor() - Method in class ElevatorAPI
    Initiates the process to open the elevator door and waits until the door is confirmed open.

    Attempts to open the elevator door if it is currently closed.

    P

    process(Request, RequestHandler) - Method in class ElevatorController
    The main entry point for processing any incoming `Request`.
    pulseCoil(int) - Method in class GenericAPI
    Sends a momentary "pulse" to a specific Modbus output coil.
    pulseMotor(int) - Method in class ElevatorAPI
    Sends a momentary "pulse" to a specific motor control coil based on a speed category.

    Q

    queue - Variable in class RequestHandler
    A thread-safe list used to store all pending Request objects.

    R

    remove(Request) - Method in class RequestHandler
    Removes a specific Request object from the queue.
    Request - Class in Unnamed Package
    Represents a request made within the elevator system.
    Request(int, String) - Constructor for class Request
    Constructs a new Request object from a given ID and a code string.
    RequestHandler - Class in Unnamed Package
    The `RequestHandler` class is a central component of the elevator simulation system, responsible for managing the lifecycle of all elevator requests.
    RequestHandler() - Constructor for class RequestHandler
     
    reset() - Method in class ElevatorAPI
    Performs a comprehensive reset of the elevator's operational state, bringing it to a safe, known condition.
    resetSystem(RequestHandler) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Resets the entire elevator system to a safe, initial state.

    S

    sensorTriggered(int) - Method in class ElevatorAPI
    Reads the state of a general Modbus discrete input sensor at a given address.
    setCoil(int, boolean) - Method in class GenericAPI
    Sets the binary state (ON or OFF) of a single Modbus output coil.
    setCrawl(int) - Method in class ElevatorAPI
    Sets the elevator's crawl speed.
    setRegister(int, int) - Method in class GenericAPI
    Writes a single integer value to a specified Modbus holding register.
    startProducer(Scanner, Runnable) - Method in class RequestHandler
    Initializes and starts a dedicated daemon thread responsible for continuously reading user input from the console, parsing it into Request objects, and adding them to the internal request queue.
    stopMovement() - Method in class ElevatorController
    Safely stops all elevator motor movements by individually turning off each motor and setting the crawl speed to zero.

    T

    toString() - Method in class Request
    Returns a string representation of the Request object.

    U

    UP - Enum constant in enum class Direction
    Represents the state where the elevator is currently moving or intends to move upwards.

    V

    validateFloorRequest(Request, RequestHandler) - Method in class ElevatorController
    Validates a floor request, ensuring the requested floor is within the valid range (1 to 4).

    Returns the enum constant of this class with the specified name.
    values() - Static method in enum class Direction
    Returns an array containing the constants of this enum class, in the order they are declared.
